description: The 'code_environments' dataset provides a comprehensive overview of various code environments used within a software or data science platform. Each entry in the dataset represents a distinct environment, detailing its name, programming language, deployment mode, and owner. Additionally, it includes technical specifications such as the Python interpreter version, core package set, and the file path where the environment is stored. The dataset also records the disk size in megabytes, offering insights into the storage requirements of each environment. A unique feature of this dataset is the 'usages' column, which lists the projects or applications that utilize each environment, providing a clear view of its application scope. This dataset is particularly useful for system administrators and data scientists who need to manage and optimize code environments, ensuring compatibility and efficiency across different projects. It can also aid in auditing and tracking the usage of resources within an organization.
shortDesc: Dataset of code environments with details on language, owner, and usage.

columns.name: envName
columns.comment: Name of the code environment, identifies environment.

columns.name: envLang
columns.comment: Programming language used, specifies environment language.

columns.name: deploymentMode
columns.comment: Mode of deployment, indicates management type.

columns.name: pythonInterpreter
columns.comment: Python version used, specifies interpreter version.

columns.name: corePackagesSet
columns.comment: Core package configuration, defines package set.

columns.name: path
columns.comment: File path to environment, locates environment storage.

columns.name: disk_size_megabytes
columns.comment: Disk size in megabytes, indicates storage usage.

columns.name: usages
columns.comment: List of projects using environment, shows application scope.
